law.text: Any person who places any obstruction, including poles, wires, signboards, fences, gas, water, sewerage, oil or other pipelines, on any part of the right-of-way of any state highway, or under any such highway, before obtaining the permit required by subsection (3) of KRS 416.140, or who fails to remove any obstruction when given notice as provided in that subsection, shall be fined not less than ten dollars ($10) nor more than one hundred dollars ($100), and each day the obstruction is continued without a permit or after such notice to remove shall constitute a separate offense.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1599c-1.
